metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（大满超级站气象要素梯度观测系统-2017）
metadata.description:
This data set contains the data of meteorological element gradient observation system of dashman superstation in the middle reaches of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2017.The station is located in the farmland of daman irrigation district of zhangye city, gansu province.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 100.3722e, 38.8555n and 1556m above sea level.The wind speed/direction, air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 3m, 5m, 10m, 15m, 20m, 30m and 40m respectively, with a total of 7 layers, facing due north.The barometer is installed at 2m;The tilting bucket rain gauge was installed at about 8m on the west side of the tower, with a height of 2.5m;The four-component radiometer is installed at 12m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 12m, facing due south and the probe facing vertically downward.Soil heat flow plate (self-calibration formal) (3 pieces) were buried in the ground 6cm in turn, 2m away from the tower body due south, two of which (Gs_2 and Gs_3) were buried between the trees, and one (Gs_1) was buried under the plants.The mean soil temperature sensor TCAV is buried 2cm and 4cm underground, facing due south and 2m away from the tower body.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water sensor is buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The photosynthetic effective radiometer is installed at 12m with the probe facing vertically upward.Four other photosynthetically active radiometers were installed above and inside the canopy, 12m above the canopy (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), and 0.3m above the canopy (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), facing due south.
The observation items are: wind speed (WS_3m, WS_5m, WS_10m, WS_15m, WS_20m, WS_30m, WS_40m) (unit: m/s), wind direction (WD_3m, WD_5m, WD_10m, WD_15m, WD_20m, WD_30m, WD_40m) (unit:Air temperature and humidity (Ta_3m, Ta_5m, Ta_10m, Ta_15m, Ta_20m, Ta_30m, Ta_40m and RH_3m, RH_5m, RH_10m, RH_15m, RH_20m, RH_30m, RH_40m) (unit: Celsius, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit: hpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), four-component radiation (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit:Watts/m2), surface radiant temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: Celsius), average soil temperature (TCAV) (unit: Celsius), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/m2), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit:Soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm)Mmol/m s) and the upward and downward photosynthetic effective radiation (PAR_D_up, PAR_D_down) under the canopy (in mmol/m s).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Due to sensor problems, the soil heat flux G2 was wrong;Due to problems with the collector, the meteorological data were wrong;Part of soil data was wrong due to collector problem;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2017-6-10:10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al. (2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2017年1月1日至2017年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游大满超级站气象要素梯度观测系统数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市大满灌区农田内，下垫面是玉米田。观测点的经纬度是100.3722E, 38.8555N，海拔1556m。风速/风向、空气温度、相对湿度传感器分别架设在3m、5m、10m、15m、20m、30m、40m处，共7层，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在塔西侧约8m处，架高2.5m；四分量辐射仪安装在12m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在12m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤热流板（自校正式）（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，朝向正南距离塔体2m处，其中两块（Gs_2、Gs_3）埋设在棵间，一块（Gs_1）埋设在植株下面；平均土壤温度传感器TCAV埋设在地下2cm、4cm处，朝向正南，距离塔体2m处；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；光合有效辐射仪安装在12m处，探头朝向是垂直向上；另有四个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方和冠层内，冠层上方安装在12m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）、冠层内安装在0.3m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）高处，朝向正南。
观测项目有：风速（WS_3m、WS_5m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_20m、WS_30m、WS_40m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_3m、WD_5m、WD_10m、WD_15m、WD_20m、WD_30m、WD_40m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_3m、Ta_5m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_20m、Ta_30m、Ta_40m和RH_3m、RH_5m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_20m、RH_30m、RH_40m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度) 、光合有效辐射（PAR）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、冠层上向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)和冠层下向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_D_up、PAR_D_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；2017.6.8-7.2由于传感器的问题，土壤热通量G2出现错误；2017.8.31-9.11由于采集器的问题，气象部分数据出现错误； 2017.9.19-10.15日由于采集器问题，土壤部分数据出现错误；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2017-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间的关系更为复杂。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的现象。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量来更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境恶化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），阿拉尔海流域（斯坦耶夫等，2004；克雷托等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（斯通，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们展示了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures in an oasis-desert ecosystem?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中土壤和树冠成分温度的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: In an oasis-desert ecosystem, soil and canopy component temperatures were measured using a Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera, which was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform. This method involved capturing thermal images approximately every 120 minutes from 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time to collect data on thermal radiation over cropland.
Example.AnswerCn: 在一个绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，使用Fluke Ti55热红外相机测量了土壤和树冠组件的温度，该相机在一个25米高的平台上手动操作。该方法涉及从中国标准时间07:00到19:00每120分钟捕捉一次热图像，以收集农田的热辐射数据。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in measuring energy exchange in arid regions, particularly in relation to evapotranspiration models?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区测量能量交换时面临的一个挑战，特别是在蒸散发模型方面，是缺乏准确的土壤水分和气象数据，这可能导致模型预测的不准确性。
Example.AnswerEn: One example of a challenge in measuring energy exchange in arid regions is the difficulty in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas. This challenge is compounded by the incomplete energy balance closure in eddy covariance (EC) flux measurements and the errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，测量能量交换的一项挑战是准确估计强对流灌溉农业区域的表面通量的困难。这一挑战因涡度协方差（EC）通量测量中能量平衡闭合的不完整性以及从复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而加剧。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges faced in measuring and validating evapotranspiration components, such as evaporation and transpiration, using remote sensing and ground-based methods?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 测量和验证蒸散发组成部分（如蒸发和蒸腾）时，使用遥感和地面方法可能面临的潜在挑战包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures, image classification errors, uncertainties in estimating incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances, strong advective conditions
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 确定地表土壤和植被组成温度的误差、图像分类误差、估算入射短波和长波辐射透过率的不确定性、强烈的平流条件。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What characteristics define a long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux observation dataset in oasis–desert areas?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，长期能源、水汽和碳通量观测数据集的特征包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: half-hourly turbulent flux data, eddy covariance system, scintillometer, hydrometeorological data, auxiliary data involving vegetation and soil parameters, spans multiple years
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 半小时湍流通量数据，涡度相关系统，闪烁仪，水文气象数据，涉及植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，跨越多年。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the role of an eddy covariance system in data collection for hydrometeorological studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统在水文气象研究中的数据收集中扮演着什么角色？
Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance system is used to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data, which are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in ecosystems. This system provides detailed observations of these exchanges and helps in evaluating models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统用于获取半小时的湍流通量数据，这对于理解生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。该系统提供了这些交换的详细观测，并有助于评估诸如双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型等模型。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with measuring evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中测量蒸散发面临的挑战有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: Measuring evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes is challenging due to the difficulty in separating soil and vegetation components, especially in areas with mixed land cover. This challenge is exacerbated by uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences and errors in image classification, which can affect the accuracy of models like the TSEB model.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中测量蒸散发是一个挑战，因为很难分离土壤和植被成分，尤其是在混合土地覆盖的区域。这一挑战因地表与空气温度差异的不确定性以及图像分类中的错误而加剧，这可能影响像TSEB模型这样的模型的准确性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for meteorological parameters in an oasis–desert system compare to those in an irrigated agricultural area in terms of temporal resolution and instrumentation?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，气象参数的数据收集方法与灌溉农业区相比，在时间分辨率和仪器设备方面有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In an oasis–desert system, half-hourly turbulent flux data are acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, with additional hydrometeorological data observed from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. In an irrigated agricultural area, meteorological parameters are measured every 10 minutes with instruments like a four-component radiometer and an eddy covariance system. Both systems use high-frequency measurements, but the oasis–desert system includes a broader range of instruments for capturing data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，并通过自动气象站观察额外的水文气象数据，后者的平均观测周期为10分钟。在灌溉农业区，气象参数每10分钟测量一次，使用的仪器包括四分量辐射计和涡度协方差系统。这两个系统都使用高频测量，但绿洲-沙漠系统包含更广泛的仪器来捕获数据。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges can be inferred from the observed data errors and quality control issues in maintaining accurate long-term environmental datasets?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从观察到的数据错误和质量控制问题中，可以推断出在维护准确的长期环境数据集时面临的挑战。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges inferred from observed data errors and quality control issues include sensor malfunctions leading to data gaps, the need for rigorous data validation to remove outliers or physically meaningless values, and the complexity of maintaining consistent data quality over long periods. These challenges highlight the importance of robust data processing and error-checking protocols to ensure dataset reliability.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 从观察到的数据错误和质量控制问题中推断出的挑战包括传感器故障导致的数据缺口，需要严格的数据验证以去除异常值或物理上无意义的值，以及在长时间内保持一致的数据质量的复杂性。这些挑战突显了强大数据处理和错误检查协议的重要性，以确保数据集的可靠性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why are long-term observations critical for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are critical for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems because they provide a quantitative understanding of oasis–desert interactions, crucial for ecological stability and socioeconomic development, especially given the challenges of ecological degradation in these areas.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要，因为它们提供了对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的定量理解，这对生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要，尤其是在这些地区面临生态退化挑战的情况下。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to errors in the classification of soil and canopy component temperatures using thermal imaging?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响热成像中土壤和冠层成分温度分类错误的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in the classification of soil and canopy component temperatures using thermal imaging are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance, and the ignoring of atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, leading to uncertainties in estimated temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用热成像技术对土壤和冠层组件温度的分类错误主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，并且忽略了大气向上辐射和透射率，导致估计温度的不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the implementation of long-term observational data collection impact the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据收集的实施将如何影响对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long-term observational data collection can provide crucial insights into the dynamics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, allowing for the recognition of trends and interactions within oasis–desert ecosystems, which is vital for maintaining ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期的观察数据收集可以提供关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换动态的重要见解，从而识别绿洲-沙漠生态系统内的趋势和相互作用，这对于维持生态稳定和支持这些地区的社会经济发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind establishing a multi-layered meteorological observation network in an agricultural setting for data collection?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在农业环境中建立多层次气象观测网络进行数据收集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include accurately capturing the microclimatic variations in an agricultural setting, understanding the interactions between soil, vegetation, and atmospheric components, and supporting water resource management and ecological research in arid and semi-arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括准确捕捉农业环境中的微气候变化，理解土壤、植被和大气成分之间的相互作用，以及支持干旱和半干旱地区的水资源管理和生态研究。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to employ a high-resolution thermal camera for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in evapotranspiration studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在蒸散发研究中，使用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层成分温度的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Employing a high-resolution thermal camera is important to obtain accurate soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for separating and validating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration measurements. This helps improve the accuracy of models like the two-source energy balance model in heterogeneous landscapes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪对于获取准确的土壤和冠层成分温度至关重要，这对于分离和验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发测量非常重要。这有助于提高在异质景观中如两源能量平衡模型等模型的准确性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the goal of long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期能量、水蒸气和碳交换观测的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to quantitatively understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding is crucial for maintaining ecological stability, achieving sustainable development, and supporting carbon neutrality goals in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是定量理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换动态。这种理解对于维持生态稳定、实现可持续发展以及支持这些地区的碳中和目标至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key steps involved in ensuring the quality and reliability of data collected from a meteorological observation network, particularly in an agricultural setting?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保农业环境中气象观测网络收集的数据质量和可靠性的关键步骤包括：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The quality and reliability of data collected from a meteorological observation network in an agricultural setting can be ensured by implementing several measures: (1) Ensuring consistent data collection with a specified frequency, such as collecting data every 10 minutes and marking missing data with a placeholder (e.g., -6999); (2) Identifying and correcting errors caused by sensor malfunctions, such as incorrect readings from soil heat flux sensors or data acquisition issues that lead to missing data for certain periods; (3) Removing duplicate records to maintain data integrity; (4) Filtering out data that exceed physical limits or instrument ranges; (5) Highlighting questionable data portions for further review; and (6) Standardizing date and time formats and ensuring they are recorded in the same column for consistency.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在农业环境中，确保气象观测网络收集的数据质量和可靠性可以通过实施以下措施来实现：(1) 确保以指定频率进行一致的数据收集，例如每10分钟收集一次数据，并用占位符（例如 -6999）标记缺失数据；(2) 识别并纠正由传感器故障引起的错误，例如土壤热通量传感器的错误读数或导致某些时期缺失数据的数据采集问题；(3) 删除重复记录以维护数据完整性；(4) 过滤掉超过物理限制或仪器范围的数据；(5) 突出显示可疑数据部分以便进一步审查；(6) 标准化日期和时间格式，并确保它们记录在同一列中以保持一致性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can data from meteorological observation networks be utilized to model evapotranspiration and energy balance in agricultural ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 气象观测网络的数据如何用于建模农业生态系统中的蒸散发和能量平衡？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data from meteorological observation networks can be utilized to model evapotranspiration and energy balance in agricultural ecosystems through several approaches: (1) Using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration with models like the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model; (2) Validating model estimates with observed ratios of evaporation and transpiration using stable isotopes and measurements from systems such as eddy covariance; (3) Applying thermal infrared camera data to obtain high-resolution temperature inputs for the model; (4) Incorporating data on soil heat flux and radiative transfer obtained from ground-based measurements; and (5) Classifying thermal images into soil and canopy pixels to accurately compute component temperatures, which are then used in energy balance equations to separate latent and sensible heat fluxes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 气象观测网络的数据可以通过几种方法用于建模农业生态系统中的蒸散发和能量平衡：(1) 使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，通过像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型来估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发；(2) 利用稳定同位素和涡度协方差等系统的观测比率验证模型估算的蒸发和蒸腾；(3) 应用热红外相机数据获取高分辨率温度输入用于模型；(4) 纳入从地面测量获得的土壤热通量和辐射传输数据；(5) 将热成像分类为土壤和冠层像素，以准确计算组分温度，然后将其用于能量平衡方程中，以分离潜热和显热通量。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do long-term observations from multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations enable a deeper understanding of oasis–desert interactions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 长期观测多个陆面通量和气象站的数据如何加深对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term observations from multiple stations provide comprehensive datasets that include energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with hydrometeorological data. This extensive data collection allows for the analysis of temporal trends and interactions between oasis and desert systems, contributing to ecological stability and sustainable development insights.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 长期的多站点观测提供了全面的数据集，包括能量、水汽和碳通量，以及水文气象数据。这种广泛的数据收集使得能够分析绿洲和沙漠系统之间的时间趋势和相互作用，为生态稳定性和可持续发展提供了见解。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in ensuring the reliability of soil and canopy component temperature data used in energy balance models, and how could these affect expected model outcomes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在确保用于能量平衡模型的土壤和冠层组件温度数据的可靠性时，可能会出现哪些挑战，这些挑战又会如何影响预期的模型结果？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges include image classification errors that lead to misidentification of soil and vegetation pixels, resulting in overestimation of canopy temperature. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric radiation might contribute to uncertainties, impacting the accuracy of soil and canopy component temperatures and consequently affecting the model's performance in estimating energy fluxes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 挑战包括图像分类错误，导致土壤和植被像素的误识别，从而导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，忽视大气辐射可能会导致不确定性，影响土壤和冠层组分温度的准确性，从而影响模型在估算能量通量方面的性能。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might long-term observational datasets of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems not meet expected research needs for understanding ecological stability and socioeconomic development?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 长期观测的能量、水汽和碳交换数据集在绿洲-沙漠系统中可能无法满足理解生态稳定性和社会经济发展的预期研究需求，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term datasets are crucial but may be inadequate due to ecological crises like river and lake drying, land desertification, and dust storms, which can alter ecosystem dynamics. Additionally, balancing the oasis and desert systems is critical, and without comprehensive data, understanding interactions and ensuring sustainable development can be challenging.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期数据集至关重要，但由于生态危机，如河流和湖泊干涸、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴，这些数据可能不足以反映生态系统动态。此外，平衡绿洲和沙漠系统至关重要，如果没有全面的数据，理解相互作用并确保可持续发展将面临挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the data collection methods used in meteorological and hydrological observations for ensuring data accuracy and reliability in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，气象和水文观测所使用的数据收集方法在确保数据准确性和可靠性方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods, including the use of automatic weather stations with 10-minute average periods and eddy covariance systems, are designed to provide accurate and reliable data. These methods, supplemented by additional hydrometeorological data and soil parameters, are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems. However, challenges such as data errors due to sensor issues and environmental conditions, as mentioned in the metadata, need to be addressed to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法，包括使用10分钟平均周期的自动气象站和涡度协方差系统，旨在提供准确可靠的数据。这些方法辅以额外的水文气象数据和土壤参数，对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。然而，正如元数据中提到的，由于传感器问题和环境条件导致的数据错误等挑战需要解决，以确保数据的准确性和可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in the continuous collection and processing of meteorological data over a long-term period in the context of oasis-desert regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，长期持续收集和处理气象数据可能会面临哪些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting meteorological data over a long period in oasis-desert regions can include sensor malfunction, data loss, environmental degradation affecting sensor readings, and difficulties in maintaining data consistency and quality control. Specific issues such as data errors during certain periods due to collector problems and the impact of environmental conditions like soil temperature and moisture on data accuracy are notable challenges.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区长期收集气象数据的挑战包括传感器故障、数据丢失、环境退化影响传感器读数，以及维护数据一致性和质量控制的困难。具体问题如在某些时期由于采集器问题导致的数据错误，以及土壤温度和湿度等环境条件对数据准确性的影响，都是显著的挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can datasets covering energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in arid regions be expanded or refined to better support research objectives related to sustainable oasis development?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 涵盖干旱地区能源、水汽和碳交换的数据集可以通过哪些方式扩展或精炼，以更好地支持与可持续绿洲发展相关的研究目标？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Datasets can be expanded or refined by incorporating additional parameters such as methane fluxes, enhancing the spatial coverage of observations, increasing the frequency of data collection, and integrating remote sensing data. Long-term observations and supplementary data on vegetation and soil parameters can also enhance the datasets. Utilizing advanced data processing techniques and ensuring robust quality control measures are critical for supporting research objectives related to sustainable oasis development.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据集可以通过纳入额外参数（如甲烷通量）、增强观测的空间覆盖、增加数据收集的频率以及整合遥感数据来扩展或精炼。长期观测和关于植被及土壤参数的补充数据也可以增强数据集。利用先进的数据处理技术并确保稳健的质量控制措施对于支持与可持续绿洲发展相关的研究目标至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data collection methods are applied in heterogeneous landscape conditions for accurate evapotranspiration estimation.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在异质景观条件下如何应用数据收集方法以准确估算蒸散发。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In heterogeneous landscape conditions, the application of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is crucial for estimating evapotranspiration (ET). The model partitions energy between the soil and vegetation components, considering their distinct temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. This approach allows the TSEB model to provide a more accurate estimation of ET compared to one-source models.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在异质景观条件下，应用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型对于估算蒸散发（ET）至关重要。该模型在土壤和植被组件之间划分能量，考虑它们各自的温度和能量交换的阻力。这种方法使得TSEB模型能够提供比单源模型更准确的ET估算。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert ecosystems and how these challenges impact the reliability of long-term observational datasets.

Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include the complex interactions between oasis and desert systems, the degradation of the ecological environment, and the difficulty in measuring fluxes accurately due to factors such as strong advection and image classification errors. These challenges can impact the reliability of long-term datasets by introducing uncertainties in measurements, particularly in arid and semi-arid regions where the oasis-desert interactions are critical for ecological stability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括绿洲与沙漠系统之间复杂的相互作用、生态环境的退化，以及由于强对流和图像分类错误等因素导致的准确测量通量的困难。这些挑战可能会通过引入测量的不确定性，影响长期数据集的可靠性，特别是在绿洲-沙漠相互作用对生态稳定性至关重要的干旱和半干旱地区。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential strategies for expanding or refining datasets related to hydrometeorological observations in oasis-desert areas, ensuring the inclusion of essential parameters for understanding energy and water vapor exchange.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别潜在的策略，以扩展或完善与绿洲-沙漠地区水文气象观测相关的数据集，确保包含理解能量和水汽交换的基本参数。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential strategies include establishing more land surface flux and meteorological stations to capture a broader range of data. Incorporating advanced remote sensing technologies and updating existing measurement systems can enhance the accuracy and scope of data. Additionally, integrating auxiliary data involving vegetation and soil parameters, along with consistent data processing and quality control procedures, can improve the dataset's comprehensiveness for understanding energy and water vapor exchange in oasis-desert areas.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的策略包括建立更多的地表通量和气象站，以捕获更广泛的数据。结合先进的遥感技术和更新现有的测量系统可以提高数据的准确性和范围。此外，整合涉及植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，以及一致的数据处理和质量控制程序，可以提高数据集的全面性，以便更好地理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量和水汽交换。
